A **robe** is a type of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is made of [leather](/wiki/Leather "Leather"), and has the [randomized appearance](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") of a "colored robe" when unidentified.

SLASH'EM robes are based more directly on their predecessors in [NetHack Plus](/wiki/NetHack_Plus "NetHack Plus"), an ancestor to SLASH'EM, rather than the [robes](/wiki/Robe "Robe") that would later appear in vanilla *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. Also unlike the robe of *NetHack*, there are four different type of robes, with randomized appearances for each:

- [robe](#Description)
- [robe of power](/wiki/Robe_of_power "Robe of power")
- [robe of weakness](/wiki/Robe_of_weakness "Robe of weakness")
- [robe of protection](/wiki/Robe_of_protection "Robe of protection")

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

[Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") start the game with a +1 robe, while [Priests](/wiki/Priest "Priest") start the game with a +0 robe.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

Several monsters can generate with a robe:

- [Wraiths](/wiki/Wraith_\(monster_class\) "Wraith (monster class)") have a 1⁄2 chance of generating with a robe.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)
- [Aligned priests](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest"), [high priests](/wiki/High_priest "High priest"), the [Arch Priest](/wiki/Arch_Priest "Arch Priest"), and [player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") [priests](/wiki/Priest_\(player_monster\) "Priest (player monster)") may also generate with a robe.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)
- [Mind flayers](/wiki/Mind_flayer "Mind flayer") have a 1⁄2 chance of [generating with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a robe, while [master mind flayers](/wiki/Master_mind_flayer "Master mind flayer") have a 4⁄5 chance of generating with a robe.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)
- The [Grand Master](/wiki/Grand_Master "Grand Master") and [Master Kaen](/wiki/Master_Kaen "Master Kaen") have a 10⁄11 chance of generating with a robe.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)

## Description

While worn, a robe confers 1 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC").

## Strategy

Body armor robes are lighter than [leather armor](/wiki/Leather_armor "Leather armor") and do not interfere with spellcasting or a Monk's melee abilities and AC bonuses, though it will negate the AC bonuses specific to [doppelganger](/wiki/Doppelganger_\(starting_race\) "Doppelganger (starting race)") characters. They can be trivially distinguished via [price identification](/wiki/Price_identification "Price identification") due to their base cost of 25[zm](/wiki/Zm "Zm") (where all other robes have a base cost of 50), and are much more common compared to other robes.

## Encyclopedia entry

Robes are the only garments, apart from Shirts, ever to have sleeves. They have three uses:  
1\. As the official uniform of Priests, Priestesses, Monks, Nuns (see Nunnery), and Wizards. The OMT \[ Official Management Term ] prescribed for the Robes of Priests and Nuns is that they \_fall in severe folds\_; of Priestesses that they \_float\_; and of Wizards that they \_swirl\_. You can thus see who you are dealing with.  
2\. For Kings. The OMT here is \_falling in stately folds\_.  
3\. As the garb of Desert Nomads. \[...]

\[ The Tough Guide to Fantasyland, by Diana Wynne Jones ]

SLASH'EM robes are based more directly on their predecessors in NetHack Plus, an ancestor to SLASH'EM, rather than the robes that would later appear in vanilla NetHack. Also unlike the robe of NetHack, there are four different type of robes, with randomized appearances for each:

Several monsters can generate with a robe:

  • Wraiths have a 1⁄2 chance of generating with a robe.[3]
  • Aligned priests, high priests, the Arch Priest, and player monster priests may also generate with a robe.[4][5]
  • Mind flayers have a 1⁄2 chance of generating with a robe, while master mind flayers have a 4⁄5 chance of generating with a robe.[6][7]

They can be trivially distinguished via price identification due to their base cost of 25zm (where all other robes have a base cost of 50), and are much more common compared to other robes.
